In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df[:dt])
    return df
end
```

This function iterates over each element in the `dt` column, extracts the year and month from that date using the `Dates.year` and `Dates.month` functions respectively, then combines them into a single integer with a format of "yyyymm". The result is stored in the new column `ym`. 

Please note that this function assumes that your DataFrame has a DateTime column named `:dt`. If it doesn't or if you have a different column name, you will need to adjust the function accordingly.
